metadata.description: Name of your cluster - Between 3 and 23 characters. Letters and numbers only. Also used as a prefix for many resources.
Virtual Machine administrative user name
Remote desktop user password. Must be a strong password
Port for TCP Client Connection end point to perform management operations on this cluster
Port for Http Client Connection end point to perform management operations on this cluster
Front end, public port 1 to use. Replace it with what your application uses
Front end, public port 2 to use. Replace it with what your application uses

Back end, private port 1 to use. Replace it with what your application uses

Durability level of the VM Scale Sets for all nodes
Size/Sku used for the Front End node type instances
Number of Front End node type instances
Size/Sku used for the Back End node type instances
Number of Back End node type instances

Number of Management node type instances
Durability level of all Service Fabric node types

The store name where the cert will be deployed in the virtual machine
Certificate Thumbprint
Resource Id of the key vault, is should be in the format of /subscriptions/<Sub ID>/resourceGroups/<Resource group name>/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/<vault name>
Refers to the location URL in your key vault where the certificate was uploaded, it is should be in the format of https://<name of the vault>.vault.azure.net:443/secrets/<exact location>
Protection level.Three values are allowed - EncryptAndSign, Sign, None. It is best to keep the default of EncryptAndSign, unless you have a need not to
